Detailed Description

A WallpaperDelegate is responsible for showing a live wallpaper behind applications that would like to sit on top of it.

This Delegate object itself does very little -- its only purpose is to generate instances of WallpaperDelegate as needed. Implementing a wallpaper thus involves subclassing from this, subclassing an Engine implementation, and implementing onCreateWallpaperEngine() to return a new instance of your WallpaperEngine.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::service::WallpaperDelegate::onCreate ( ) [virtual]

Called by the system when the service is first created.

Do not call this method directly.

virtual WallpaperEngine* gaia::service::WallpaperDelegate::onCreateWallpaperEngine ( ) [pure virtual]

Must be implemented to return a new instance of the wallpaper's WallpaperEngine.

Note that multiple instances may be active at the same time, such as when the wallpaper is currently set as the active wallpaper and the user is in the wallpaper picker viewing a preview of it as well.

virtual void gaia::service::WallpaperDelegate::onDestroy ( ) [virtual]

Called by the system to notify a Delegate that it is no longer used and is being removed.

The service should clean up any resources it holds (threads, registered receivers, etc) at this point. Upon return, there will be no more calls in to this Delegate object and it is effectively dead. Do not call this method directly.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::service::WallpaperDelegate::SERVICE_INTERFACE ( ) [static]

The Demand that must be declared as handled by the Delegate.

To be supported, the service must also require the BIND_WALLPAPER permission so that other applications can not abuse it.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::service::WallpaperDelegate::SERVICE_META_DATA ( ) [static]

Name under which a WallpaperDelegate component publishes information about itself.

This meta-data must reference an XML resource containing a <wallpaper> tag.
